result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick F Degrave

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Patrick F Degrave in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Patrick F Degrave. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a plea date in 60 days. 

Court will set matter for a plea date. Court will set on older matter on trial calendar if plea hearing does not occur.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:01 AM Defendant Patrick F Degrave in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Patrick F Degrave.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:47 AM Defendant Patrick F Degrave in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Patrick F Degrave. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for bail/bond hearing. 

Defense makes arguments in support of motion to modify bail. 
State makes arguments in opposition to motion. 
Defense makes further statements in support of motion. 

For reasons stated on the record the court will amend the cash bond on both cases to $200.00 cash, conditions remain as previously set.

CASH BOND AMENDED TO $200.00

Defendant to comply with ID processing.
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Patrick F Degrave in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Patrick F Degrave. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
